alert.note: Alert for Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 6:03PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Charleston. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6 PM EST, South Carolina Department of Public Safety reported a lane of Highway 17 closed due to flooding north of McClellanville. In addition, public reports indicates that flooding continues on Kat Hill Road and portions of Highway 17 between McClellanville and Awendaw. Much of northern Charleston County has received between 6 to 8 inches. The USCRN site at the Coastal Reserve near McClellanville reported 13.3 inches of rain today. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Pleasant, McClellanville, Isle Of Palms, Awendaw, Garris Landing, Bull Island, Lighthouse Island, Cape Romain, Price Inlet, Cape Island, Hampton Plantation State Park, Santee Coastal Reserve, Capers Inlet, Buck Hall, Tibwin, South Santee, Germantown, Capers Island, Dewees Island and Wild Dunes.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
